missing_critical: Explicit mention of the five 'big ideas' of AI from AI4K12 working group not clearly highlighted as foundational framework
17 competencies mentioned in text but only Competency 16 (Ethics) and Competency 17 (Programmability) explicitly shown - full list missing
12 Design Considerations mentioned but only 4-5 explicitly detailed in excerpt
Relationship between AI literacy and other literacies (digital, computational, scientific, data) not fully synthesized in summary
missing_minor: Specific conference details (CHI '20, April 25-30, 2020, Honolulu) not in kernel findings
Acknowledgment of Georgia Institute of Technology support

errors: Generated document states '16 Kern-Kompetenzen' but original text indicates at least 17 competencies exist (Competency 16 and 17 explicitly numbered)
distortions: Definition of AI Literacy slightly condensed - original emphasizes 'critically evaluate', 'communicate and collaborate', and 'use as tool' as three distinct but interconnected aspects; summary merges these somewhat
Methodology description uses 'Scoping Study' terminology correctly but doesn't emphasize that this is NOT a systematic review - adequate but could be clearer about implications

missing_categories: Explainable_AI / Transparenz - extensively discussed but not as standalone category (appears within KI_Sonstige)
Accountability - explicitly discussed as ethical issue but not separate category
Privacy - mentioned in ethics section but not standalone category
Algorithm_Transparency - central theme throughout but subsumed in other categories
Theory_of_Mind - theoretical framework for understanding perception of AI agents not captured as category

content_fixes.fix: Change '16 Kern-Kompetenzen' to 'mindestens 17 Kern-Kompetenzen (inklusive Ethics und Programmability)' oder 'Framework mit umfassenden Kompetenzen'

content_fixes.add_point: Third bullet: 'Das Framework basiert auf fünf "Big Ideas" der AI4K12-Initiative: (1) Computers perceive the world using sensors, (2) Agents maintain models and use them for reasoning, (3) Computers can learn from data, (4) Making agents interact with humans is substantial challenge, (5) AI can impact society in positive and negative ways.'

content_fixes.issue: Missing explicit AI4K12 reference as primary framework source
